content.description: Stand start on in the middle of the slippery slab. Climb up and left, following the line of better holds. The crux is at the bottom, and it eases up quite a bit at the top, but it is pretty high.
content.protection: A few pads and an attentive spotter, you do not want to fall from the top
content.location: Past the parking lot, just past the narrowest part of the notch on your way to stow. There is a place to park right next to this boulder, but if you are going to work on problems there, you might not want to park your car there.

content.description: Same start as the Masochist (sit) but move slightly right after the first left hand slap to the crimp on the arete. Right hand then goes to a sid-pull/undercling (far right). After this heel hook your left foot and slap up to a flat vertical rail about a foot from the arete, work the feet up a bit and fire for the lip (either straight up or farther right) then top that bull out! Really great line with powerful, oppositional climbing. A great complementary route to "The Masochist" that is arguably a little less masochistic....
content.protection: Couple pads. One to cover the ground and one to cover the boulder behind you....
content.location: Right next to the last switchback literally at the top of the notch....

content.description:
Sit start matched on a small but good right facing sidepull a few feet off of the ground. Pull on and move up and slightly right to a gaston pinch. From here figure out how to match and make your way up to the lip. 

 There is a lot of climbing packed into this short boulder problem.
content.protection: 3 pads. 2 pads on the rock behind and a mini pad to sit on for the start.
content.location: About four feet right of Sadomasochist, in the middle of the overhanging face.

content.description: Stand start, carefully making your way onto the slippery slab. Climb to the top using underlclings.
content.protection: A few pads. This one is pretty tall.
content.location: Past the parking lot, just past the narrowest part of the notch on your way to stowe. There is a place to park to the left of this boulder, but if you are going to work on problems here, you might not want to park your car there.

content.description: Sit start on the steep wall, work your way out the the arete, slap up, and top out. Stand start goes at V4.
content.location: Past the parking lot, just past the narrowest part of the notch on your way to stow. There is a place to park right next to this boulder, but if you are going to work on problems there, you might not want to park your car there.

content.description: Stand start with a high left hand sloper on the large right leaning diagonal rail. (This is not the last left hand hold used for Sadomasochist, but a similar and worse hold found further right.) The right hand start hold is an obvious fang-like undercling. Compress the two holds, find some feet and pull onto the overhang. Once established, dyno for the sloping lip. Match the lip and topout.This move is very similar to the last move on "Sadomasochist".
content.location: This problem is several feet right of the arete of "Masochist" and is found to the left of "Phantom of Finesse". The landing is awkward and uneven due to the small boulder.

content.description: Climbs the right side of the overhang and right arete. Start low and climb straight up on sidepulls and the arete.
content.location: to the right of Sado, still on the overhang

content.description: Start on the left arete with a slopey foot near the ground right on the arete. Get your right foot on somewhere and grab the nice jug up and right. Figure out how to climb up the rest of the arete or move over onto the slab up high.
content.location: To the left of Notchless and Top of the Notch

content.description:
This climbs the face on the right of Sado, which is the opposite side of the boulder from Notchless.

 Start with a left hand on a low pinch on the left arete and a bad right hand sidepull on the face. Pull on and figure out how to get up to a nice incut crimp above the right hand start. Top out directly above (harder) or traverse right and top out near the right arete on the better top out holds.
content.location: to the right of the Sado overhang

content.description: A great boulder with climbs on all four sides, 2 of which are vertical and slick, 1 of which is overhanging and powerful.
